intro: Peucedanum angolense, commonly known as Angolan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its seeds are small and dry, often dispersed by wind, and the plant is known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine. It is also used as a forage plant for livestock in some regions.
